Instrument_Host.name: Spitzer Space Telescope
Instrument_Host.description: The Spitzer Space Telescope was an observatory that operated in a solar, Earth-trailing orbit, featuring 3-axis stabilization and three cryogenically-cooled instruments to observe from the near- to far-infrared spectrum. It had an 85 cm aperture, a diffraction limit of 5.5 microns, a field of view of approximately 5 arcmin x 5 arcmin for each band, and exceptional pointing stability of less than 0.1 arcsec, with a maximum tracking rate of 1.0 arcsec/sec. Its instruments included the InfraRed Array Camera (IRAC), InfraRed Spectrograph (IRS), and Multiband Imaging Photometer for Spitzer (MIPS).
